title: Bug 108822 - More efficient disk sorting logic needed for handling border values in row data processing
OB: When sorting data on disk, if the data consists of 40000 rows and the program is instructed to process less than 40000 rows, the current behavior is as follows: 1. The data is saved as a temporary file. 2. The file is called into memory. 3. Sorting is performed on the data. 4. The sorted data is saved back to the temporary file.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Sort on disk. 2. Use data with 40000 rows. 3. Set the program to process less than 40000 rows. Follow these steps: 1. Save the file as a temporary file. 2. Call the file into memory. 3. Sort the data. 4. Save the sorted data back to the temporary file.
